page.title: 04FINHAM SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: First established 1932 to treat 3million gallons per day(m.g.d) later enlarged to 9(m.g.d) in 1955, then 12 (m.g.d) in 1961. A doubling of the capacity was undertaken with an extend ed project which was carried through in 5 stages, these became operational in 1965, 1967, 1969(two stages) and the final stage in 1973. Plans for a future extension are already under way In 1970 capacity was 23(m.g.d), anoth er 2(m.g.d) was treated at Baginton In November 1970 sewage treatment ceased at Baginton and Finham became the main centre for the treatment of waterborne industrial wastes and sewage from the City of Coventry and certain surround ing areas. The majority of electrical power generated in the power house co mes from a link up into the local E.M. E.B. supply. Monitoring and cont'd...
